reasons_to_visit.details: Witness Malmö emerging from winter as parks like Kungsparken, Slottsträdgården, and Pildammsparken start to bloom. Enjoy the increasing daylight hours.
Experience the start of the outdoor seating season ('uteserveringar') at cafes in charming squares like Lilla Torg and Davidshallstorg, perfect for 'fika'.
Explore Malmö's diverse neighborhoods like Gamla Staden, Västra Hamnen, and Möllevången on foot or by bike in pleasant, pre-summer temperatures.
Visit key attractions such as Malmö Castle (Malmö Museer), Moderna Museet, or the Form/Design Center with potentially fewer crowds and possibly better accommodation prices (outside Easter).
Experience the traditional Swedish welcome to spring (Valborg) with bonfires, singing, and community gatherings, often held in parks like Folkets Park.
April is a good time for comfortable day trips to nearby cities like Copenhagen or the university town of Lund via the Öresund Line train before peak season.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: April in Malmö brings variable weather. Sunny days are possible, but expect frequent cool winds, rain showers, and generally unsettled conditions common to Skåne's coast.
Average temperatures are still cool, ranging from lows around 3-4°C to highs around 11-12°C. Wind chill, especially near the coast (Ribersborg, Västra Hamnen), can make it feel colder.
If Easter occurs in April, be aware of potential closures or reduced hours for shops (including Systembolaget) and some services on public holidays.
Spring blooms mean the beginning of pollen season (especially birch), which could affect allergy sufferers.
The Öresund strait remains very cold; while coastal walks are lovely, swimming is generally only for the very hardy or those using the Kallbadhus sauna.
While the city is active, peak summer activities (like extensive beach services or frequent outdoor events) haven't fully started.

weather.precipitation: Variable; expect cloudy periods, rain showers, and potentially strong breezes. Sunny intervals are also possible.
weather.general_tips: Layering is essential: thermal base, fleece or sweater, windproof and waterproof outer layer, hat, scarf, gloves. Waterproof shoes highly recommended.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to Moderate. Quieter than summer, but can increase if Easter falls within this period.
tourism_level.pricing: Generally mid-range for accommodation, potentially lower than summer but higher around Easter.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City feels fresh and is slowly waking up. Parks are greening. Good time for museum visits and exploring neighborhoods without large crowds.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Påsk)
events_holidays.description: Public holidays on Good Friday, Easter Sunday, and Easter Monday. Primarily a family-focused holiday.
events_holidays.notes: Many shops, especially Systembolaget, have reduced hours or are closed. Check attraction opening times. Public transport runs, often on a Sunday schedule.

events_holidays.name: Outdoor Dining Season Begins
events_holidays.description: Cafes and restaurants officially open their outdoor seating areas ('uteserveringar'), especially visible in Lilla Torg, Davidshall, and Möllevången.
events_holidays.notes: Comfort depends entirely on the day's weather; blankets are often provided!

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic heart of Malmö, including the lively squares Stortorget & Lilla Torg and the charming cobblestone streets and colorful houses of Gamla Väster.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestones. Enjoy fika at a cafe on Lilla Torg.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit Malmö Museer at Malmö Castle
unique_experiences.description: Explore the various museums housed within Scandinavia's oldest preserved Renaissance castle, including history exhibits, an aquarium, and art.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Check for combined tickets if visiting associated museums.

unique_experiences.description: Visit Malmö's museum for modern and contemporary art, housed in a striking building. Features changing exhibitions.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check current exhibitions online. Often free entry for under 18s.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk or Cycle in Kungsparken & Slottsparken
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy Malmö's beautiful central parks, connected by canals. See the windmill (Slottsmöllan) and the Castle Garden (Slottsträdgården) as spring emerges.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Paths are well-maintained. Rent a bike for wider exploration. Visit the Slottsträdgården Kafé.

weather.precipitation: Continues to be variable, potential for slightly more frequent mild, sunny days but rain and wind remain common.
weather.general_tips: Layering remains key. Be prepared for both cool breezes and potentially warmer sunshine.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate. Activity picks up towards the end of the month, especially around Valborg.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Noticeable spring feeling. More greenery, longer days. City feels increasingly lively, outdoor seating more utilized on good days.

events_holidays.name: Art Week Malmö
events_holidays.description: A week dedicated to contemporary art with exhibitions, open studios, performances, and events across various galleries and art institutions in Malmö.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official Art Week Malmö program for venues and schedules.

events_holidays.name: Walpurgis Night (Valborgsmässoafton / Valborg)
events_holidays.description: Traditional Swedish celebration welcoming spring. Expect bonfires, choir singing, and public gatherings in parks (like Folkets Park or Pildammsparken).
events_holidays.notes: Popular local event. Dress warmly for evening outdoor activities. Student celebrations in nearby Lund are particularly large.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the modern, sustainable waterfront district. Admire the iconic Turning Torso skyscraper and walk along the Sundspromenaden boardwalk for sea views.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Can be windy. Take bus #2 or #3 from Central Station. Good spot for sunset views over the bridge.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the vibrant, multicultural neighborhood. Visit the lively Möllevångstorget market (best mornings) for produce and atmosphere. Try affordable falafel, a Malmö specialty.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bring cash for market stalls, though many take cards/Swish. Explore the diverse food shops.

unique_experiences.description: Experience the historic open-air bathhouse ('Kallis'). Enjoy a traditional Swedish sauna with views over the Öresund, maybe followed by a quick, cold sea dip.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Separate sections for men/women, usually nude. Bring a towel. Check opening hours.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the charming, historic university town. Explore Lund Cathedral, the picturesque streets, Kulturen open-air museum, and the botanical garden.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Frequent trains from Malmö C (approx. 10-15 mins). Very walkable city.
